item.title: Oil Pauses After China Cuts Policy Rates
item.description: Oil prices were steady as a rate cut from China’s central bank only moderately boosted sentiment around the nation’s economy and “will hardly reverse appetite for Chinese investments as meaningful fiscal stimulus becomes necessary,” Swissquote Bank said.

item.title: China's Central Bank Cuts Two Key Policy Rates
item.description: China’s central bank cut two key policy rates, signaling that the country’s benchmark lending rates will fall later this month.

item.title: Russia Imposes Emergency Rate Rise to Halt Ruble Selloff
item.description: The currency’s recent slide is an indication of the growing uncertainties facing an economy battling resurgent inflation, the mounting impact of sanctions and a drastic labor shortage.

item.title: China Slashes Rates, Suspends Youth Jobless Data
item.description: The twin moves come as fresh data added to worrying signals on the health of the world’s second-largest economy.

item.title: Pandora Raises Growth Guidance
item.description: Pandora forecasts 2023 organic revenue growth of 2%-5% after it reported a solid start to the third quarter with some improvement in sales in the U.S. and China but a below-forecast second-quarter net profit.

item.title: China Evergrande New Energy Vehicle Shares Gain on $500 Mln Investment
item.description: Shares of China Evergrande New Energy Vehicle Group rose after Dubai-based mobility and green-energy company NWTN agreed to make a strategic investment of US$500 million.

item.title: Weakness in Bond Markets Is Visible
item.description: Bond market weakness stands out in the absence of apparent bearish drivers and Tuesday’s two-way data impetus hardly offers lasting relief, Commerzbank Research said.

item.title: UK Record Wage Growth Leaves BOE With Another Tough Decision
item.description: UPDATED: Average weekly earnings in the U.K. excluding bonuses gained pace at 7.8% in the three months to June, complicating the BOE’s efforts to bring down inflation ahead of its next interest-rate decision in September.

item.title: Japan's Economy Grows at 6% Pace in Second Quarter
item.description: Exports rise and surge in foreign visitors helps lift spending.

item.title: Legal & General First Half Tops Consensus
item.description: Legal & General posted a lower first-half operating profit of £941 million but a higher solvency coverage ratio of 230%, and backed its mid-term targets.

item.title: M&S Confident on Full-Year as Current Sales Rise
item.description: Marks & Spencer said food sales for the first 19 weeks of fiscal 2024 grew more than 11%, while clothing & home sales rose above 6%, adding that interim results should show a significant improvement against prior expectations, with full-year profit growth also expected.

item.title: Who Are Trump's Co-Defendants in the Georgia RICO Case?
item.description: In addition to the former president, 18 others were indicted by an Atlanta-area grand jury after several witnesses gave testimony.

item.title: Gold Steady; May Be Weighed by Higher Treasury Yields
item.description: Gold was steady in the early morning Asian session, but could be weighed by higher Treasury yields, which undermine the appeal of the non-interest-bearing precious metal.

item.title: Australian Consumer Confidence Firms as Rates Peak
item.description: Australian consumer confidence improved strongly last week amid widening confidence that official interest rates are close to their peak.

item.title: Nikkei Rises 0.6%, Led by Electronics Stocks
item.description: Japanese stocks ended higher, led by gains in electronics shares, after stronger-than-expected domestic growth data for the April-June period.

item.title: Donald Trump Indicted in Georgia Over Effort to Overturn Election Results
item.description: The charges brought by Fulton County’s district attorney mark the fourth criminal case against the former president.

item.title: The Airport Is an Increasingly Dangerous Place to Work
item.description: As travel rebounds, understaffed ground crews are getting injured and even killed.

item.title: Argentina's dollar bonds tumbled and the peso weakened, a day after a libertarian outsider won a primary ahead of the country's October's election.
item.description: Argentina’s dollar bonds tumbled and the peso weakened, a day after a libertarian outsider won a primary ahead of the country’s October’s election.

item.title: China's deepening economic slump is damaging the fortunes of big American companies entrenched there, with some growing increasingly pessimistic that the country's long-awaited postpandemic boom will materialize.
item.description: China’s deepening economic slump is damaging the fortunes of big American companies entrenched there, with some growing increasingly pessimistic that the country’s long-awaited postpandemic boom will materialize.

item.title: UBS will pay $1.44 billion to settle Justice Department allegations that it defrauded investors who bought bonds backed by mortgages before the financial crisis.
item.description: UBS will pay $1.44 billion to settle Justice Department allegations that it defrauded investors who bought bonds backed by mortgages before the financial crisis.
